title: buildcache create ends without finishing, gives Warning: 'Name' object has no attribute 's'
body:
Edit: Here is the output of running the buildcache create command with debug flag:
```spack -d buildcache create ... ```
LOG HERE ---> [bc_create.log](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/3744784/bc_create.log)

@becker33

`spack buildcache create` sometimes fails to finish, giving the warning shown below. I have only observed this with a small set of packages, which I will attach below -- the use case is the same for each of the packages in the list. First I install from a concrete spec yaml file:
```
$> spack install --no-cache --overwrite -y -f /hostmount/spack-env/llvm_nlxngt.spec.yaml
```

Then I try to cache the package and the following Warning is given:
```
$> spack buildcache create --no-deps -afr -d /hostmount -k prl -y /hostmount/spack-env/llvm_nlxngt.spec.yaml
==> Warning: 'Name' object has no attribute 's'
==> createtarball, reading spec from /hostmount/spack-env/llvm_nlxngt.spec.yaml
==> creating binary cache file for package llvm@9.0.0%gcc@7.3.0~all_targets build_type=Release +clang+compiler-rt+gold+internal_unwind+libcxx~link_dylib+lld+lldb~omp_tsan+polly~python~shared_libs arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
```

At this point, if you check `build_cache` directory, you will find a directory entry `gcc-7.3.0/llvm-9.0.0` and it will contain a .tar.gz file. No .spec.yaml file is created for llvm as one would expect under build_cache/

I've attached the exact llvm concretized .spec.yaml file below.

Other packages where I have observed this:
* mesa@18.3.6%gcc@7.3.0+glx+llvm+opengl~opengles+osmesa
* swig@4.0.0%gcc@7.3.0 
* lvm@8.0.0%gcc@7.3.0~all_targets build_type=Release +clang+compiler-rt+gold+internal_unwind+libcxx~link_dylib+lld+lldb~omp_tsan 
* flang@20180921
* qwt@6.1.3%gcc@7.3.0~designer 
* qt@5.11.3%gcc@7.3.0~dbus~examples~framework freetype=spack ~gtk~krellpatch+opengl 
* catalyst@5.6.0%gcc@7.3.0
* glew@2.0.0%gcc@7.3.0

llvm_nlxngt.spec.yaml:
```
spec:
- llvm:
    version: 9.0.0
    arch:
      platform: linux
      platform_os: rhel7
      target: x86_64

    parameters:
```
